Guardians

Dad Egbert

  • John's dad takes multiple trips to the store on any given day due to the sheer amount of compulsive baking he does, leading to running out of baking supplies rather quickly (143). Author Commentary.
  • "This is not the first time John's dad has encountered a bath tub in the hallway. Not even close," (208). Author Commentary.
  • Cirque du Soleil filed a restraining order against Dad Egbert (253).
  • There was an umbrellakind strife specibus in the study of John's house (1061).
  • "On Jade's birthday, nanna was locked onto in John's neighborhood, by the Betty Crocker factory. The meteor carrying baby Jade crashed into the factory and destroyed it. Her grandpa, the owner of that factory, would adopt her. John's dad witnessed, and would spend years investigating."

Mom Lalonde

  • Mom Lalonde's 20 foot tall, 10 ton (1149, Author Commentary) granite statue of Zazzerpan the Learned statue was "installed through a hole in the roof with a heavy-duty crane," (358).
  • "It is strongly implied [the SkaiaNet laboratory] is where Rose's mom grew up... Who raised her? Was it the owner of Skaianet, a younger grandpa Harley? Did he outsource parenting duties to someone else in the lab? Maybe some exiles? If so, she had an upbringing fairly similar to that of Roxy in the future," (905). Author Commentary.
  • "Finally entering the Medium is a significant moment for Mom Lalonde as well. She clearly knew this day was coming. Spent most of her life doing whatever she was doing in that lab behind the house, as well as raising her daughter for this day. When the time comes, she slips out the back and gets on a boat to who knows where. She's finally free. By leaving the martini glass there, is she indicating she's finally kicking the habit too?" (1498). Author Commentary.
  • Mom Lalonde traveled to Dad Egbert's town "at the behest of a famous and wealthy scientist [Jake Harley] to study one of numerous recent celestial anomalies while he is on expedition," (1882).
    • "She's been working with him for a long time." Author Commentary.
    • "Mom would bring Rose to John's neighborhood to investigate the destruction of grandpa's factory, and related stellar phenomena," (1988).

Bro Strider

  • Bro had a friend(?) named Dennis, mentioned in a GameBro article on SBURB (42).
  • Bro spends most of his time in the living room, crashing on the futon there at night. He also takes Lil Cal out on gigs in a puppet chest, otherwise leaving him on display when at home (447).
  • The password to Bro's computer is implied to be 'lilcal' (456, 457).
  • Bro uses the program COMPLETE BULLSHIT to monitor various sites, including Dave's various blogs and SBaHJ (459).
  • Bro "rakes in thousands of dollars a month through [smuppets]" and his website, Plush Rump (460).
  • Bro has several webcams around the apartment (570).
  • Bro is in his thirties (871). Author Commentary.
  • The meteor that Dave came on wrecked Bro's favorite record shop (1878).
  • Bro cut a meteor in half (1940).
    • "It seems absolutely crazy that Bro's standing on a meteor and riding it down to Earth. Until you realize (later in this very animation) that they all came down to Earth that way as infants. So it's second nature to them in a way, and they seem inoculated to the ill effects of riding a flaming meteor." Author Commentary.
    • "I wonder how Bro's board knows what to do. Some sort of AI embedded in it? That explanation wouldn't be totally baseless." Author Commentary.

Grandpa Harley

  • Jade's grandpa collected objects that correlated with the other pre-scratch guardians (852, 853, 854). Main Pages + Author Commentary.
  • "It is a little-known canon fact that Old Jake Harley has had dozens of children with many families strewn all over the world over the course of his very long life," (1874). Author Commentary.
  • Grandpa Harley and Jade's family name is Harley because Colonel Sassacre's dog was named Halley, which Grandpa mispronounced, and then he... took that name from the dog to be his own (1921)?
  • Grandpa Harley left Nanna to go adventuring when they were both thirteen (1922).
  • "Grandpa stole the Fourth Wall of Jack's cubicle," (1987).
  • Grandpa Harley's "birthday"/meteorday was 8 days after Nanna's, rather than being the same as Jake's.

Alpha John

Alpha Jade

Alpha Rose

  • Alpha Rose was in her fifties when she killed Guy Fieri and rode his corpse down a waterfall (1585). Author Commentary.

Alpha Dave
